User Agent: Opera/9.80 (X11; Linux x86_64; U; en-GB) Presto/2.10.229 Version/11.60

Steps to reproduce:

Open an article page on the website geenstijl.nl with a lot (200+) of comments, for example http://www.geenstijl.nl/mt/archieven/2011/12/pvv_compleet_mislukte_politiek.html

This problem does not seem to occur on Linux or Mac, but I have reproduced it both on windows xp and windows 7.
This problem is probably older than Firefox 9, but I'm afraid I won't be able to pinpoint when this bug first arose.


Actual results:

After scrolling through the page, the comments start running through one another incrementally, until there is nothing more than a black mishmash.


Expected results:

The text should be displayed normally :p

comments.text:
I saved the mentioned URL above with Firefox to disk (complete webpage).
 
Started to strip HTML piece by piece..

When the webpage consisted out of basic structure only, I continued stripping the CSS, and figured out that the following line in base.css
is what caused to trigger this bug:

#content {
background: -moz-linear-gradient(left, #DADADA 0%, #FFFFFF 3%, #FFFFFF 97%, #DADADA 100%);
}

I'm very sure this bug started with Firefox 7.

Tested my findings on a few different hardware configurations, to be sure.

A race condition is probably not what's causing this, right?
 
For a reproducible offline version, here are two links:

Without the line commented out:

http://search-geenstijl.thruhere.net/search/with-bug.zip

and _with_ the line commented out:

http://search-geenstijl.thruhere.net/search/without-bug.zip

Hope this helps you guys to find this little creepy crawler.

cheers.

atm0s
